question: The NFS servers ____________
options: ['a) are stateless', 'b) save the current state of the request', 'c) maybe stateless', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option2: b) save the current state of the request

question: Every NFS request has a _________ allowing the server to determine if a request is duplicated or if any are missing
options: ['a) name', 'b) transaction', 'c) sequence number', 'd) all of the mentioned']

question: A server crash and recovery will __________ to a client
options: ['a) be visible', 'b) affect', 'c) be invisible', 'd) harm']
explanation: All blocks that the server is managing for the client will be intact.

question: The server must write all NFS data ___________
options: ['a) synchronously', 'b) asynchronously', 'c) index-wise', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: A single NFS write procedure ____________
options: ['a) can be atomic', 'b) is atomic', 'c) is non atomic', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: The NFS protocol __________ concurrency control mechanisms
options: ['a) provides', 'b) does not provide', 'c) may provide', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: _______________ in NFS involves the parsing of a path name into separate directory entries – or components
options: ['a) Path parse', 'b) Path name parse', 'c) Path name translation', 'd) Path name parsing']

question: For every pair of component and directory vnode after path name translation ____________
options: ['a) a single NFS lookup call is used sequentially', 'b) a single NFS lookup call is used beginning from the last component', 'c) at least two NFS lookup calls per component are performed', 'd) a separate NFS lookup call is performed']
option1: a) a single NFS lookup call is used sequentially
option2: b) a single NFS lookup call is used beginning from the last component
option3: c) at least two NFS lookup calls per component are performed
option4: d) a separate NFS lookup call is performed

question: When a client has a cascading mount _______ server(s) is/are involved in a path name traversal
options: ['a) at least one', 'b) more than one', 'c) more than two', 'd) more than three']
